*Today’s Verses:*

*Jesus traveled through all the cities and villages of that **area,
teaching in the synagogues and announcing the **Good *

*News** about the Kingdom. And wherever He **went, He healed the people of
every sort of disease **and illness. He felt great pity for the crowds
that **came, because their problems were so great and **they *

*didn’t know where to go for help. *(Mt. 9:35-37)

*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus was and is moved by the condition of the people’s lives. He came to
be the Shepherd the one who could show people

how to avoid life’s pitfalls (see Jn. 10:14). Jesus looked at the crowds
following Him and referred them as a field ripe for

harvest. Many people are ready to give their lives to Christ if someone
would show them how. Jesus commands us to

pray that people will respond to this need for workers. Often, when we pray
for something God answers our prayers by

using us. *Be prepared for God* *to use you to show another person the way
to Him.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: LOVE BEYOND HUMAN UNDERSTANDING
reflection:
This “fullness” is fully expressed in Christ (Colossians 2:9-10), in union with Christ and through His empowering Spirit, we are complete. We have all the fullness of God available to us. But we must appropriate that fullness through faith and through prayer as we daily live for Him, Paul’s prayer for the Ephesians, and also for us.
is let us ask the Holy Spirit to fill every aspect of our life to the fullest.
prayer: Almighty God, fill us with Your fullness through Christ, empowering us by Your Spirit to live completely for You. May we appropriate Your abundance through faith and prayer, allowing the Holy Spirit to saturate every aspect of our lives. (AI)

subject: GENTLE BUT PERSISTENT
reflection:
Yes, I agree it can be discouraging to continue to do the right thing and receive no word of thanks or see no tangible
results.
But our efforts to influence people to love God, accept Christ as Savior, and live under the direction of the Holy Spirit
should be gentle as the tapping of a cork ball, BUT, we should also be persistent and faithful—may we be so.
prayer: Gracious God, grant us the strength to persist in our gentle efforts to share Your love, even when we see no immediate results or receive no thanks. Help us remain faithful in tapping hearts with Your message, trusting that Your Spirit is at work through our perseverance. (AI)

subject: STEADFAST IN VIEW OF SUFFERING
reflection: Even though Jesus knew He would face persecution and death in Jerusalem, He was determined to go there. Christ’s love for us compelled Him to go there. That kind of resolve should characterize our life too. When God gives us a course of action, we must move steadily toward our destination, no matter what potential hazards await us there. Let us stretch ourselves to do something that requires a sacrifice.
prayer: Holy God, grant us the courage and resolve to follow Your will, even when the path is difficult or dangerous. Strengthen our hearts to make sacrifices for Your kingdom, just as Christ sacrificed Himself for us. (AI)

*Today’s Verses:*

*As the time drew near for His return to heaven, Jesus resolutely **set out
for Jerusalem. Jesus sent messengers ahead *

*to a Samaritan village to prepare for His arrival. But they were turned
away. The people of the village refused to have any-thing to do with Jesus
because He had resolved to go to Jerusalem. *

(Lk. 9:51-53)

*Today’s Reflection:*

Even though Jesus knew He would face persecution and death in Jerusalem, He
was determined to go there. Christ’s love for us compelled Him to go there.
That kind of resolve should characterize *our* life too. When God gives us
a course of action, we must move steadily toward our destination, no matter
what potential hazards await us there. *Let us stretch ourselves to do
something that requires a sacrifice.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: HIS PROMISE WITH CONFIDENCE
reflection:
God finds great pleasure in our desire to talk with Him. He’s never to busy, and He’ll never turn us away. We can enter His presence anytime, confident that He
welcomes us, thanks to what Jesus did on the cross.
prayer: Loving God, thank You for always being available to hear our prayers and for welcoming us into Your presence through the sacrifice of Jesus. Help us to approach You with confidence and joy, knowing that You delight in our desire to communicate with You. (AI)

subject: LIVING DURING DIFFICULT TIMES
reflection:
It’ all about attitude— Someone once said, my past is gone; my presence is passing; my future is arriving.” The best thing about the future is that in comes in
degrees, a day at a time. We can manage that! Whatever it holds, our future is ours. If it be fair weather, let us bask in the sun; if it be stormy, let bend with the wind. The future belongs to those who can make adjustments. Keep your mind on God, and receive His promise of perfect peace.
prayer: Gracious God, grant us the wisdom to embrace each day as it comes, trusting in Your perfect peace to guide us through fair weather and storms alike. Help us to keep our minds fixed on You as we adjust to whatever the future may bring, knowing that our lives are in Your capable hands. (AI)

subject: THE FATHER'S GIFT
reflection:
All three persons of the trinity are mentioned in these verses, because all three participate in the work of salvation. Based upon the redemptive work of His
Son, the Father forgives us and sends His Holy Spirit to wash away our sins and continually renews us. The Holy Spirit, continually renews our hearts.
prayer: Holy God, we thank You for the beautiful work of salvation accomplished through the Trinity—the Father's forgiveness, the Son's redemption, and the Holy Spirit's renewal. May we be ever grateful for Your cleansing grace and the ongoing transformation of our hearts. (AI)

subject: JESUS, THE ONLY WAY
reflection:
Apart from what Jesus has done, the thought of aging and dying would be over whelming. Jesus’ words show that the way to eternal life is secure—that is as secure as your trust in Jesus. He has already prepared the way to eternal life. The only issue that may still be unsettled is your willingness to believe. Jesus
has promise it to all who believe in Him. Although the details of eternity are unknown, we need not fear because Jesus is preparing for us and will spend eternity with us.
prayer: Faithful God, strengthen our trust in Jesus' promise of eternal life and help us embrace the peace that comes from knowing our future is secure in Him. May we find comfort in the assurance that You have prepared a place for us and will be with us for all eternity. (AI)

spend eternity with us. *

subject: VICTORY IN CHRIST
reflection:
Jesus was not questioning God; He was quoting the first line of Psalm 22—a deep expression of the anguish He felt when He took on the sins of the whole world. Which caused Him to be separated from His Father. This is what Jesus dreaded as He prayed to God in the garden to take the cup from Him Matthew 26:39. The
physical agony was horrible, but even worse was the period of spiritual separation from God. Jesus suffered this double death so that we would never have to experience eternal separation from God.
prayer: Lord of Life, we are humbled by the profound sacrifice of Jesus who endured both physical agony and spiritual separation from You to secure our eternal connection with You. Help us to live in deep gratitude for this immeasurable gift of love and redemption. (AI)

*At about three o’clock, Jesus called out with a loud **voice, “Eli, Eli,
lema sabachthani?” which means,**“My God, my God, why have you forsaken

(Mt. 27:46)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus was not questioning God; He was quoting the first line of Ps. 22—a
deep expression of the anguish He felt when He took on the sins of the
whole world.

Which caused Him to be separated from His Father. This is what Jesus
dreaded as He prayed to God in the garden to take the cup from Him Mt.
26:39. The

physical agony was horrible, but even worse was the period of spiritual
separation from God. *Jesus **suffered this double death so that we would
never*

*have to experience eternal separation from God.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: POWER IN THE BLOOD
reflection: Our sinful nature, died once and for all, so we are freed from it's power. The "power of sin" refers to our rebellious sin-loving nature inherited from Adam. Though we often willingly cooperate with our sinful nature, it is not us but the sin in us that is evil. And it is this power of sin at work in our life that is defeated. Paul has already stated that through faith in Christ we stand acquitted, "not guilty" before God. Because of this we dare to live freely, empowered by the blood.
prayer: Merciful God, thank you for freeing us from the power of sin through Christ's sacrifice, enabling us to stand acquitted before you. Empower us to live freely and boldly in the grace you have given us, no longer bound by our sinful nature but transformed by your love. (AI)

freed from it's power. The "power of sin" refers to
our rebellious sin-loving nature inherited from
Adam. Though we often willingly cooperate with
our sinful nature, it is not us but the sin in us that
is evil. And it is this power of sin at work in our
life that is defeated. Paul has already stated that through faith in Christ

guilty" before God. *Because of this we dare to*

subject: EASTER MORROW STILLS OUR SORROW
reflection:
The resurrection validated a promise Jesus made: “I am the resurrection and the life. Anyone who believes in me will live, even after dying. (John 11:25) NLT. Jesus emerged the victor; and we are victors too. Not just over physical death someday, but over the enemy’s attempts to defeat us now. the enemy wants nothing more than to destroy us and seal us in an emotional, mental, or spiritual tomb. Alone Afraid. Helpless.
Dead to joy, peace, purpose, and passion. Dead to God’s purpose for us and to all things related to His Kingdom. Jesus said, “The thief’s purpose is to steal and kill and destroy.
My purpose is to give them a rich and satisfying life” (John 10:12) NLT. His resurrection confirmed this truth. He burst from the grave fully alive and victorious. Let’s follow in His steps.
prayer: Lord Jesus, we thank You for Your victory over death and the promise of abundant life You offer to all who believe in You. Help us to follow in Your steps, bursting free from the tombs of fear and despair, and embracing the rich and satisfying life You have prepared for us. (AI)

subject: HOW DO I KNOW JESUS LIVES?
reflection:
How do I know that Christ has risen?

What proof have I to give?

He touched my life one blessed day,

And I began to live.

How do I know He left the tomb

That morning long ago ?

I met him just this morning,

And my heart is still aglow.

How do I know that endless life

He gained for me that day?

His life within is proof enough

Of immortality.

How do I know that Christ still lives,

Rich blessing to impart?

He walks with me along the way

And lives within my heart.
prayer:
Risen Lord Jesus, thank You for the living proof of Your
resurrection in changed hearts and daily companionship. Let
Your life within me burn bright with love, hope, and
courage, so that I know You not just by report but by
encounter. Walk with me today, and make my words and works a
testimony that You live. Amen. (AI)

subject: A LIMIT TO HUMAN UNDERSTANDING
reflection:
Can you imagine what it would have been like to be Mary on that day? Her world ended with Jesus’ death.
He was her teacher, but much more, Jesus
loved her not only for what she was, but who she wanted to be. The world looks at the outside—God sees the heart. I believe Jesus saw her desperation, how lost she was without Him. And though He felt compassion, He wanted her to move on from that place. From now on she needed to learn to walk in communion with the Holy Spirit. Are there aspects of your faith you need to release in order to move onward and upward with Jesus?
prayer: Gracious God, help us to release our attachments and move forward in our faith journey, trusting in the guidance of Your Holy Spirit. May we, like Mary, learn to walk in deeper communion with You, seeing ourselves and others through Your eyes of love and compassion. (AI)

subject: THE GREAT DIVIDE OF LIFE
reflection:
Jesus says that those who believe in Him have (not will have)
eternal life. John, the author of this Gospel, has been demonstrating that Jesus is the true Son of God. Jesus sets before us the greatest choice in life. We are responsible to decide for ourselves whom we will obey.
(Joshua 24:15), and God wants us to choose Him
and live (Deuteronomy 30:15-20). The wrath of God is God’s final Judgement and rejection of the sinners. To put
off the choice is to choose not to follow Christ. The great divide comes down to choosing Christ and receiving eternal life or not believe and receive the wrath of God. Indecision is a fatal decision, especially at a time when none of us know if we will be one of the next statistics.
prayer: Holy God, we stand before You with the weight of our choices, recognizing that our decision to follow Christ is of eternal significance. Grant us the courage and wisdom to choose You daily, embracing the gift of eternal life through faith in Your Son. (AI)

subject: FOR BEST RESULTS IMITATE CHRIST
reflection:
;
The fruit of the Spirit is the spontaneous work of the Holy Spirit in us. The Spirit produces these character traits that are found in-the-nature-of-Christ. They are
the byproduct of Christ’s control—we can’t obtain them by trying to gain them without His help. If we want the fruit of the Spirit to grow in us, we must join our life to His (John 15: 4, 5). We must know
Him, love Him, remember Him, and imitate Him. As a result, we will fulfill the intended purpose of The law—to love God and our neighbors. Which of these qualities do you want the Spirit to produce in you?
prayer: Almighty God, cultivate in us the fruit of Your Spirit, that we may grow in Christlikeness and love for You and our neighbors. Help us to abide in You, that Your character may be evident in our lives. (AI)

subject: A DESERTER OR FOLLOWER
reflection:
These have to be some of the saddest words in the Scripture:
“Many of His disciples turned back and no longer followed Him” (John 6:66). I wonder how
they felt on Good Friday, on Resurrection Sunday, or the day they stood before Him, at the end of their lives.
The hymn that comes to my mind is: I have decided to follow Jesus. No turning back. No turning back. Many people look everywhere for eternal life and miss Christ, the only source.” In these days we need to stay with Him, especially when there is so much confusion as to what the future holds.
prayer: Faithful God, help us to remain steadfast in our commitment to follow Jesus, even when faced with uncertainty or temptation to turn away. Strengthen our resolve to stay close to You, the true source of eternal life, no matter what challenges we may encounter. (AI)

subject: HIS IDENTITY REVEALED
reflection:
Just after Jesus’s Triumph over death, Cleopas and another disciple traveled the road to Emmaus, discussing our Lord and His empty tomb. As they walked, Christ
joined them, but they did not recognize Him. After reaching the village, they invited Him to join them at the table, and He accepted. As Jesus gave thanks and broke the bread with them, their eyes were opened, and they saw Him for who He truly was. As Jesus gave thanks, what did He say that revealed His true
identity to the apostles? I wonder, because after they recognized Him He disappeared. Had He told them all they needed to hear and cut the meeting short. I‘m sure His prayer would forever remain
embedded in their minds. Let us remember to ask our Lord to always supply the right things to say so friends will welcome Him into our visit.
prayer: Lord Jesus, open our eyes to recognize Your presence in our daily lives and conversations. Help us to speak Your words of truth and love, that others may be drawn to You through our interactions. (AI)

I‘m sure His prayer would forever remain

embedded in their minds. *Let us*

friends will welcome Him into our visit.*

subject: ALONE WITH THE FATHER
reflection:
People were flocking to hear Jesus preach and to have their diseases healed, but Jesus often withdrew to a quiet solitary place to pray. I don’t think anyone would disagree with me when I say: many things clamor for our attention, and we often
run ourselves ragged attending to them. Like Jesus, however, we should take time to withdraw to a quiet and deserted place
to pray. Our strength comes from God, and we can only be strengthened by spending time with Him.
prayer: Gracious God, help us follow Jesus' example by withdrawing from the clamor of daily life to spend quiet time with You in prayer. Strengthen and renew us through these moments of solitude, that we may better serve You and others. (AI)

subject: KNOWN THROUGH AND THROUGH
reflection:
We have become a more transient society do to the job market. Also, studies reveal that many people substitute social media
for real-life personal interaction. A person who had been moving around the country as an empty nester said, he was made aware of the power of a smile and a friendly greeting to ease loneliness. He said it has also taught me to find com-
fort in knowing that even when people ignore me, Jesus loves me so much that His eyes never leave me.
None of us like to feel invisible.
prayer: Loving God, help us to see and acknowledge those around us, offering smiles and friendly greetings to ease the loneliness of others in our increasingly disconnected world. Remind us always of Your unfailing love and constant presence, even when we feel invisible or ignored by those around us. (AI)

subject: SEEKING OPPORTUNITIES

subject: THE BEST NEWS EVER
reflection:
Teaching.
Disciples are made not only through baptism, but through the ongoing work of the church. Observe all. Here Christians are called to do more than “obey”; they are called to treasure God’s Word in their hearts. Commanded, not only by Christ’s moral (law) but also
His invitation to trust Him (the Gospel). I am with you always. He is present especially in His church and congregation on earth as Mediator, Head, King, and
High Priest. This presence is not a part, or only one half of Him. Christ’s entire person is present, to which both of His natures belong, the divine and the human—not only according to His divinity, but also according to, and with, His revealed human nature. End of the age. Is when He returns visibly. We must make Jesus King of our life and worship Him as our Savior, King, and Lord.
prayer: Almighty God, guide us to treasure Your Word in our hearts and to fully embrace Christ's teachings as we make disciples and build Your church. May we always remember Your promise to be with us, trusting in Your presence until the end of the age. (AI)

subject: GRACE IN ABUNDANCE
reflection:
How often do we receive God’s favor in our daily living? I would say we receive such grace—unearned and undeserved favor—only because of Jesus Christ. Yes,
we are saved by Him for eternity, but we are also sustained by Him daily. And believe me, Jesus also will surprise us with His lavish gifts.
prayer: Gracious God, help us recognize and appreciate the unearned favor You bestow upon us each day through Jesus Christ. May we be ever grateful for Your sustaining grace and the unexpected blessings that remind us of Your boundless love. (AI)

subject: HE IS AWARE OF OUR NEEDS
reflection:
Jesus looked at people and knew exactly what they needed. He confronted the Pharisees' hypocrisy (Matthew 23). He knew the woman who touched His robe needed a personal encounter besides physical
healing (Luke 8:43-48). Jesus wants to pinpoint the cause of our painful symptoms and show us the cure. He is waiting for us to consult Him.
prayer: Loving God, grant us the wisdom to seek Your guidance and the courage to confront our deepest needs, just as Jesus did with those He encountered. Help us to trust in Your healing touch and personal care for our lives. (AI)

subject: REMAINING IN THE PRESENCE OF HIS LOVE
reflection:
Let us remember to ask Jesus to help us remain present in His love. We should want to be aware of all that Jesus brings to our life each day. When we are aware
of His presence, we can experience abundant joy and enjoy all the beauty of life, no matter how big or small. My desire is to be fully present, basking in the pleasures of Jesus as He guides me in life. Today, take some time to appreciate all your surroundings.
prayer: Merciful God, help us remain present in Your love and aware of all the blessings You bring to our lives each day. May we experience abundant joy and appreciate the beauty around us, both big and small, as we bask in Your presence and follow Your guidance. (AI)

subject: LOOKING FORWARD
reflection:
Now as we face the battles that are common to everyone, I have found peace in the knowledge that He has everything under control. Every day of our life was written in His book even before we were born. (Psalm 139:16). He knew us at our
very beginning, and He is walking beside us as we face the middle of this life. We can trust He’ll carry us through to a happy ending. And that will be the start of an even better story.
prayer: Faithful God, as we navigate life's challenges, grant us the peace that comes from trusting in Your sovereign plan and constant presence. Help us to remember that You have authored our story from beginning to end, and to find comfort in knowing that You walk beside us through every chapter. (AI)

subject: KNOWING YOUR RESPONSIBILITY
reflection:
Our oneness in Christ does not destroy our individuality. The Holy Spirit has given each Christian special gifts for
building up the church. Now that we have these gifts, it is crucial to use them. Are you spiritually mature, exercising the gifts God, that He has given you? If you know what your gifts are, look for opportunities to serve. If you do not know, ask God to show you, perhaps with
the help of your minister or Christian friends you will recognize, your special area of service, use your gifts to strengthen and encourage the church.
prayer: Holy God, help us recognize and faithfully use the unique spiritual gifts You have bestowed upon each of us to build up Your church and glorify Your name. Guide us to serve others with humility and love, growing in spiritual maturity as we fulfill the purpose You have set before us. (AI)

subject: REACHING FOR THE GOAL
reflection:
The Bible says that God is love (I John 4:8). It also tells us that Jesus and His Father are one, which means Jesus is love.
We are told to abide in, dwell in Him, which means immersing ourselves in that vast pool of love until it can be said of us: The good news is that the goal won’t come in striving, but in diving in and becoming.
prayer: Loving God, immerse us in Your vast pool of love, that we may abide in You and become more like Jesus. Help us to dive deep into Your love, not striving in our own strength, but allowing Your transforming power to shape us into vessels of Your compassion. (AI)

subject: WHERE HAVE YOU PLACED YOUR PRIORITY
reflection:
To “make the Kingdom of God your primary concern” means to put God first in your life, to fill your thoughts with His desires, to take His character for your pattern, and to serve Him in everything. What is really important to you? People-- objects--goals--and other desires all
compete for priority. Any of these can quickly bump God out of first place if you don’t actively choose to give Him first place in every area of your life.
prayer: Almighty God, help us to prioritize Your Kingdom above all else, aligning our thoughts, desires, and actions with Your will. May we actively choose to give You first place in every area of our lives, resisting the competing priorities that can so easily distract us from Your purpose. (AI)

peace, grace, love, and joy. Or we can hand our fears and ourselves over to the only Safe Place, Jesus.

subject: TRUE IDENTITY
reflection:
In saying that the Lord your God is God of all gods and Lord of lords, Moses was distinguishing the true God from all the local gods worshiped throughout the land.
Then Moses went a step further, calling God “mighty and awesome.” He has such awesome power and justice that people cannot stand before Him without His mercy. Fortunately, His mercy toward His people is unlimited. When we began to grasp the extent of His mercy toward us we see what true love is and how deeply God loves us. Although our sins deserve severe judgment, God has chosen to show love and mercy to all who seek Him.
prayer: Holy God, we stand in awe of Your mighty power and justice, recognizing that we cannot approach You without Your boundless mercy. Thank You for demonstrating true love through Your unlimited compassion towards us, despite our sins, and for welcoming all who earnestly seek You. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*The Lord your God is the God of all gods and Lord of **all lords. He is
the Great*

*God, **mighty and awesome, **who shows no partially and takes no bribes. *

(Deut. 10:17)



*Today’s Reflection:*

In saying that the Lord your God is God of all gods and Lord of lords,
Moses was distinguishing the true God from all the local gods worshiped
throughout the land.

Then Moses went a step further, calling God “mighty and awesome.” He has
such awesome power and justice that people cannot stand before Him without
His mercy. Fortunately, His mercy toward His people is unlimited. When we
began to

grasp the extent of His mercy toward us we see what true love is and how
deeply God loves us. *Although our sins deserve* *severe judgment, **God
has chosen to show love* *and mercy to all **who seek Him.*

* Pastor Sather*

Fortunately, His mercy toward His people is unlimited. When we began to grasp the extent of His mercy toward us we see what true love is and how deeply God loves us. Although our sins deserve severe judgment, God has chosen to show love and mercy to all who seek Him.
